A jekyll template for a bioinformatics tutorial

Generate a template for a multi-page tutorial that will be used to deliver bioinformatics training

This template will be rendered by Github pages

Maximise compatibility, reduce dependency on third party plugins

Required features:

  • The tutorial is based on a set of markdown files, in a specific order. For simplicity let‚Äôs use _posts/YYYY-MM-DD_title.md, but we will ignore the actual date and just use it to sort the pages
  • Left navigation will show the list of pages and highlight the current one.
  • Support for code blocks and syntax highlighting is essential
  • Tables must be nicely formatted with thin gray cell borders to increase readability
  • Support for collapsible blocks (i.e. solutions to questions) that will be collapsed by default. For example native github markdown supports this: ‚Äú‚Äù‚Äù
What is this script doing? The script will: 1. Check you are on an EBAME VM 2. Install some packages with apt, including `visidata` is a tool to visualise tabular data (tsv, csv). 3. Install a configuration profile for GNU Screen 4. Make a `$VIROME` variable to quickly find our data
